00041 extern UChar*
00042 onig_error_code_to_format(int code)
00043 {
00044   const char *p;
00045 
00046   if (code >= 0) return (UChar* )0;
00047 
00048   switch (code) {
00049   case ONIG_MISMATCH:
00050     p = "mismatch"; break;
00051   case ONIG_NO_SUPPORT_CONFIG:
00052     p = "no support in this configuration"; break;
00053   case ONIGERR_MEMORY:
00054     p = "failed to allocate memory"; break;
00055   case ONIGERR_MATCH_STACK_LIMIT_OVER:
00056     p = "match-stack limit over"; break;
00057   case ONIGERR_TYPE_BUG:
00058     p = "undefined type (bug)"; break;
00059   case ONIGERR_PARSER_BUG:
00060     p = "internal parser error (bug)"; break;
00061   case ONIGERR_STACK_BUG:
00062     p = "stack error (bug)"; break;
00063   case ONIGERR_UNDEFINED_BYTECODE:
00064     p = "undefined bytecode (bug)"; break;
00065   case ONIGERR_UNEXPECTED_BYTECODE:
00066     p = "unexpected bytecode (bug)"; break;
00067   case ONIGERR_DEFAULT_ENCODING_IS_NOT_SETTED:
00068     p = "default multibyte-encoding is not setted"; break;
00069   case ONIGERR_SPECIFIED_ENCODING_CANT_CONVERT_TO_WIDE_CHAR:
00070     p = "can't convert to wide-char on specified multibyte-encoding"; break;
00071   case ONIGERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT:
00072     p = "invalid argument"; break;
00073   case ONIGERR_END_PATTERN_AT_LEFT_BRACE:
00074     p = "end pattern at left brace"; break;
00075   case ONIGERR_END_PATTERN_AT_LEFT_BRACKET:
00076     p = "end pattern at left bracket"; break;
00077   case ONIGERR_EMPTY_CHAR_CLASS:
00078     p = "empty char-class"; break;
00079   case ONIGERR_PREMATURE_END_OF_CHAR_CLASS:
00080     p = "premature end of char-class"; break;
00081   case ONIGERR_END_PATTERN_AT_ESCAPE:
00082     p = "end pattern at escape"; break;
00083   case ONIGERR_END_PATTERN_AT_META:
00084     p = "end pattern at meta"; break;
00085   case ONIGERR_END_PATTERN_AT_CONTROL:
00086     p = "end pattern at control"; break;
00087   case ONIGERR_META_CODE_SYNTAX:
00088     p = "invalid meta-code syntax"; break;
00089   case ONIGERR_CONTROL_CODE_SYNTAX:
00090     p = "invalid control-code syntax"; break;
00091   case ONIGERR_CHAR_CLASS_VALUE_AT_END_OF_RANGE:
00092     p = "char-class value at end of range"; break;
00093   case ONIGERR_CHAR_CLASS_VALUE_AT_START_OF_RANGE:
00094     p = "char-class value at start of range"; break;
00095   case ONIGERR_UNMATCHED_RANGE_SPECIFIER_IN_CHAR_CLASS:
00096     p = "unmatched range specifier in char-class"; break;
00097   case ONIGERR_TARGET_OF_REPEAT_OPERATOR_NOT_SPECIFIED:
00098     p = "target of repeat operator is not specified"; break;
00099   case ONIGERR_TARGET_OF_REPEAT_OPERATOR_INVALID:
00100     p = "target of repeat operator is invalid"; break;
00101   case ONIGERR_NESTED_REPEAT_OPERATOR:
00102     p = "nested repeat operator"; break;
00103   case ONIGERR_UNMATCHED_CLOSE_PARENTHESIS:
00104     p = "unmatched close parenthesis"; break;
00105   case ONIGERR_END_PATTERN_WITH_UNMATCHED_PARENTHESIS:
00106     p = "end pattern with unmatched parenthesis"; break;
00107   case ONIGERR_END_PATTERN_IN_GROUP:
00108     p = "end pattern in group"; break;
00109   case ONIGERR_UNDEFINED_GROUP_OPTION:
00110     p = "undefined group option"; break;
00111   case ONIGERR_INVALID_POSIX_BRACKET_TYPE:
00112     p = "invalid POSIX bracket type"; break;
00113   case ONIGERR_INVALID_LOOK_BEHIND_PATTERN:
00114     p = "invalid pattern in look-behind"; break;
00115   case ONIGERR_INVALID_REPEAT_RANGE_PATTERN:
00116     p = "invalid repeat range {lower,upper}"; break;
00117   case ONIGERR_TOO_BIG_NUMBER:
00118     p = "too big number"; break;
00119   case ONIGERR_TOO_BIG_NUMBER_FOR_REPEAT_RANGE:
00120     p = "too big number for repeat range"; break;
00121   case ONIGERR_UPPER_SMALLER_THAN_LOWER_IN_REPEAT_RANGE:
00122     p = "upper is smaller than lower in repeat range"; break;
00123   case ONIGERR_EMPTY_RANGE_IN_CHAR_CLASS:
00124     p = "empty range in char class"; break;
00125   case ONIGERR_MISMATCH_CODE_LENGTH_IN_CLASS_RANGE:
00126     p = "mismatch multibyte code length in char-class range"; break;
00127   case ONIGERR_TOO_MANY_MULTI_BYTE_RANGES:
00128     p = "too many multibyte code ranges are specified"; break;
00129   case ONIGERR_TOO_SHORT_MULTI_BYTE_STRING:
00130     p = "too short multibyte code string"; break;
00131   case ONIGERR_TOO_BIG_BACKREF_NUMBER:
00132     p = "too big backref number"; break;
00133   case ONIGERR_INVALID_BACKREF:
00134 #ifdef USE_NAMED_GROUP
00135     p = "invalid backref number/name"; break;
00136 #else
00137     p = "invalid backref number"; break;
00138 #endif
00139   case ONIGERR_NUMBERED_BACKREF_OR_CALL_NOT_ALLOWED:
00140     p = "numbered backref/call is not allowed. (use name)"; break;
00141   case ONIGERR_TOO_BIG_WIDE_CHAR_VALUE:
00142     p = "too big wide-char value"; break;
00143   case ONIGERR_TOO_LONG_WIDE_CHAR_VALUE:
00144     p = "too long wide-char value"; break;
00145   case ONIGERR_INVALID_CODE_POINT_VALUE:
00146     p = "invalid code point value"; break;
00147   case ONIGERR_EMPTY_GROUP_NAME:
00148     p = "group name is empty"; break;
00149   case ONIGERR_INVALID_GROUP_NAME:
00150     p = "invalid group name <%n>"; break;
00151   case ONIGERR_INVALID_CHAR_IN_GROUP_NAME:
00152 #ifdef USE_NAMED_GROUP
00153     p = "invalid char in group name <%n>"; break;
00154 #else
00155     p = "invalid char in group number <%n>"; break;
00156 #endif
00157   case ONIGERR_UNDEFINED_NAME_REFERENCE:
00158     p = "undefined name <%n> reference"; break;
00159   case ONIGERR_UNDEFINED_GROUP_REFERENCE:
00160     p = "undefined group <%n> reference"; break;
00161   case ONIGERR_MULTIPLEX_DEFINED_NAME:
00162     p = "multiplex defined name <%n>"; break;
00163   case ONIGERR_MULTIPLEX_DEFINITION_NAME_CALL:
00164     p = "multiplex definition name <%n> call"; break;
00165   case ONIGERR_NEVER_ENDING_RECURSION:
00166     p = "never ending recursion"; break;
00167   case ONIGERR_GROUP_NUMBER_OVER_FOR_CAPTURE_HISTORY:
00168     p = "group number is too big for capture history"; break;
00169   case ONIGERR_INVALID_CHAR_PROPERTY_NAME:
00170     p = "invalid character property name {%n}"; break;
00171   case ONIGERR_NOT_SUPPORTED_ENCODING_COMBINATION:
00172     p = "not supported encoding combination"; break;
00173   case ONIGERR_INVALID_COMBINATION_OF_OPTIONS:
00174     p = "invalid combination of options"; break;
00175   case ONIGERR_OVER_THREAD_PASS_LIMIT_COUNT:
00176     p = "over thread pass limit count"; break;
00177 
00178   default:
00179     p = "undefined error code"; break;
00180   }
00181 
00182   return (UChar* )p;
00183 }
00184 
00185 static void sprint_byte(char* s, unsigned int v)
00186 {
00187   sprintf(s, "%02x", (v & 0377));
00188 }
00189 
00190 static void sprint_byte_with_x(char* s, unsigned int v)
00191 {
00192   sprintf(s, "\\x%02x", (v & 0377));
00193 }
00194 
00195 static int to_ascii(OnigEncoding enc, UChar *s, UChar *end,
00196                     UChar buf[], int buf_size, int *is_over)
00197 {
00198   int len;
00199   UChar *p;
00200   OnigCodePoint code;
00201 
00202   if (ONIGENC_MBC_MINLEN(enc) > 1) {
00203     p = s;
00204     len = 0;
00205     while (p < end) {
00206       code = ONIGENC_MBC_TO_CODE(enc, p, end);
00207       if (code >= 0x80) {
00208         if (code > 0xffff && len + 10 <= buf_size) {
00209           sprint_byte_with_x((char*)(&(buf[len])), (unsigned int)(code >> 24));
00210           sprint_byte((char*)(&(buf[len+4])),      (unsigned int)(code >> 16));
00211           sprint_byte((char*)(&(buf[len+6])),      (unsigned int)(code >>  8));
00212           sprint_byte((char*)(&(buf[len+8])),      (unsigned int)code);
00213           len += 10;
00214         }
00215         else if (len + 6 <= buf_size) {
00216           sprint_byte_with_x((char*)(&(buf[len])), (unsigned int)(code >> 8));
00217           sprint_byte((char*)(&(buf[len+4])),      (unsigned int)code);
00218           len += 6;
00219         }
00220         else {
00221           break;
00222         }
00223       }
00224       else {
00225         buf[len++] = (UChar )code;
00226       }
00227 
00228       p += enclen(enc, p, end);
00229       if (len >= buf_size) break;
00230     }
00231 
00232     *is_over = ((p < end) ? 1 : 0);
00233   }
00234   else {
00235     len = (int)MIN((end - s), buf_size);
00236     xmemcpy(buf, s, (size_t )len);
00237     *is_over = ((buf_size < (end - s)) ? 1 : 0);
00238   }
00239 
00240   return len;
00241 }
00242 
00243 
00244 /* for ONIG_MAX_ERROR_MESSAGE_LEN */
00245 #define MAX_ERROR_PAR_LEN   30
00246 
00247 extern int
00248 #ifdef HAVE_STDARG_PROTOTYPES
00249 onig_error_code_to_str(UChar* s, int code, ...)
00250 #else
00251 onig_error_code_to_str(s, code, va_alist)
00252   UChar* s;
00253   int code;
00254   va_dcl
00255 #endif
00256 {
00257   UChar *p, *q;
00258   OnigErrorInfo* einfo;
00259   size_t len;
00260   int is_over;
00261   UChar parbuf[MAX_ERROR_PAR_LEN];
00262   va_list vargs;
00263 
00264   va_init_list(vargs, code);
00265 
00266   switch (code) {
00267   case ONIGERR_UNDEFINED_NAME_REFERENCE:
00268   case ONIGERR_UNDEFINED_GROUP_REFERENCE:
00269   case ONIGERR_MULTIPLEX_DEFINED_NAME:
00270   case ONIGERR_MULTIPLEX_DEFINITION_NAME_CALL:
00271   case ONIGERR_INVALID_GROUP_NAME:
00272   case ONIGERR_INVALID_CHAR_IN_GROUP_NAME:
00273   case ONIGERR_INVALID_CHAR_PROPERTY_NAME:
00274     einfo = va_arg(vargs, OnigErrorInfo*);
00275     len = to_ascii(einfo->enc, einfo->par, einfo->par_end,
00276                    parbuf, MAX_ERROR_PAR_LEN - 3, &is_over);
00277     q = onig_error_code_to_format(code);
00278     p = s;
00279     while (*q != '\0') {
00280       if (*q == '%') {
00281         q++;
00282         if (*q == 'n') { /* '%n': name */
00283           xmemcpy(p, parbuf, len);
00284           p += len;
00285           if (is_over != 0) {
00286             xmemcpy(p, "...", 3);
00287             p += 3;
00288           }
00289           q++;
00290         }
00291         else
00292           goto normal_char;
00293       }
00294       else {
00295       normal_char:
00296         *p++ = *q++;
00297       }
00298     }
00299     *p = '\0';
00300     len = p - s;
00301     break;
00302 
00303   default:
00304     q = onig_error_code_to_format(code);
00305     len = onigenc_str_bytelen_null(ONIG_ENCODING_ASCII, q);
00306     xmemcpy(s, q, len);
00307     s[len] = '\0';
00308     break;
00309   }
00310 
00311   va_end(vargs);
00312   return (int)len;
00313 }
00314 
00315 void
00316 onig_vsnprintf_with_pattern(UChar buf[], int bufsize, OnigEncoding enc,
00317                            UChar* pat, UChar* pat_end, const UChar *fmt, va_list args)
00318 {
00319   size_t need;
00320   int n, len;
00321   UChar *p, *s, *bp;
00322   UChar bs[6];
00323 
00324   n = xvsnprintf((char* )buf, bufsize, (const char* )fmt, args);
00325 
00326   need = (pat_end - pat) * 4 + 4;
00327 
00328   if (n + need < (size_t)bufsize) {
00329     strcat((char* )buf, ": /");
00330     s = buf + onigenc_str_bytelen_null(ONIG_ENCODING_ASCII, buf);
00331 
00332     p = pat;
00333     while (p < pat_end) {
00334       if (*p == '\\') {
00335         *s++ = *p++;
00336         len = enclen(enc, p, pat_end);
00337         while (len-- > 0) *s++ = *p++;
00338       }
00339       else if (*p == '/') {
00340         *s++ = (unsigned char )'\\';
00341         *s++ = *p++;
00342       }
00343       else if (ONIGENC_IS_MBC_HEAD(enc, p, pat_end)) {
00344         len = enclen(enc, p, pat_end);
00345         if (ONIGENC_MBC_MINLEN(enc) == 1) {
00346           while (len-- > 0) *s++ = *p++;
00347         }
00348         else { /* for UTF16 */
00349           int blen;
00350 
00351           while (len-- > 0) {
00352             sprint_byte_with_x((char* )bs, (unsigned int )(*p++));
00353             blen = onigenc_str_bytelen_null(ONIG_ENCODING_ASCII, bs);
00354             bp = bs;
00355             while (blen-- > 0) *s++ = *bp++;
00356           }
00357         }
00358       }
00359       else if (!ONIGENC_IS_CODE_PRINT(enc, *p) &&
00360                !ONIGENC_IS_CODE_SPACE(enc, *p)) {
00361         sprint_byte_with_x((char* )bs, (unsigned int )(*p++));
00362         len = onigenc_str_bytelen_null(ONIG_ENCODING_ASCII, bs);
00363         bp = bs;
00364         while (len-- > 0) *s++ = *bp++;
00365       }
00366       else {
00367         *s++ = *p++;
00368       }
00369     }
00370 
00371     *s++ = '/';
00372     *s   = '\0';
00373   }
00374 }
00375 
00376 void
00377 #ifdef HAVE_STDARG_PROTOTYPES
00378 onig_snprintf_with_pattern(UChar buf[], int bufsize, OnigEncoding enc,
00379                            UChar* pat, UChar* pat_end, const UChar *fmt, ...)
00380 #else
00381 onig_snprintf_with_pattern(buf, bufsize, enc, pat, pat_end, fmt, va_alist)
00382     UChar buf[];
00383     int bufsize;
00384     OnigEncoding enc;
00385     UChar* pat;
00386     UChar* pat_end;
00387     const UChar *fmt;
00388     va_dcl
00389 #endif
00390 {
00391   va_list args;
00392   va_init_list(args, fmt);
00393   onig_vsnprintf_with_pattern(buf, bufsize, enc,
00394           pat, pat_end, fmt, args);
00395   va_end(args);
00396 }
